modules.description: Validates OCaml types by generating checkers for records, variants, and lists based on annotations, using a set of predicate functions and combinators. It works with OCaml's native types, including tuples, options, and custom types, and supports nested validations. Users can enforce constraints like non-empty strings, numeric ranges, or custom business rules during data parsing or input processing.

The module provides string and structured data validation with error codes for format, length, and type checks, utilizing regex and combinators. It handles options, lists, and custom result types, supporting use cases like input validation, data parsing, and error tracking with keyed representations. Additionally, it includes functions for error comparison, pretty-printing, and extracting values from complex data structures.

Processes type declarations to generate implementation and interface code for validation logic. Operates on OCaml type declarations and AST nodes, transforming them into binding and signature items. Used to automatically create validation functions for custom types during ppx expansion.
